name: gas turbine construction, 80MW electrical, for compressed air energy storage | gas turbine, 80MW, for compressed air energy storage | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/24757/documentation

This datasets represents the construction of a gas turbine. It basically consists of the compressor, the annular combustion chamber with 24 hybrid burners, the actual turbine section and the diffuser for the exhaust gas outlet. At the heart of the turbine are the rotor blades and guide vanes, which are mounted on the shaft and guide vane carriers in both the compressor and the turbine proper. The gas turbine is linearly scaled from a capacity of 265 MW (Siemens SGT5-4000F) to 80 MW as used  for compressed air energy storage (CAES). The CAES system makes use of a gas turbine for heating up the outflow of air from the storage location.  ;according to Bouman, Evert A.; Øberg, Martha M.; Hertwich, Edgar G. (2016): Environmental impacts of balancing offshore wind power with compressed air energy storage (CAES). In: Energy 95, S. 91–98. DOI: 10.1016/j.energy.2015.11.041.;[This dataset is meant to replace the following datasets:; - gas turbine construction, 80MW electrical, for compressed air energy storage, GLO, 2015 - 2015 (74a9175e-9256-4182-b920-156a6ce06910)]

The activity starts with the raw materials for manufacturing of the gas turbine according to material composition. Proxies for metal processing data are included. Land use is not included.

The activity ends with the decommissioning of the gas turbine according to material composition.
category: C:Manufacturing/28:Manufacture of machinery and equipment n.e.c./281:Manufacture of general-purpose machinery/2811:Manufacture of engines and turbines, except aircraft, vehicle and cycle eng

processDocumentation.timeDescription: refers to publication date of literature sources
processDocumentation.geographyDescription: data refers to a global manufacturer
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: linear scaling from a 265 MW gas turbine.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription:
The inventory for raw materials is entirely based on Bouman, Evert A.; Øberg, Martha M.; Hertwich, Edgar G. (2016): Environmental impacts of balancing offshore wind power with compressed air energy storage (CAES). In: Energy 95, S. 91–98. DOI: 10.1016/j.energy.2015.11.041. The gas turbine model is a 
downscaled version (to 80 MW) of a 265 MW turbine as described 
in Parthey F., Lebenszyklusanalyse und Bestimmung von Einflussfaktoren zur nachhaltigen Produktgestaltung von GuD-Kraftwerken. Brandenburgische Technische Universität Cottbus; 2011
